Key Match Events: Immanuel Quickley scored 22 points on 7-of-12 shooting and was active enough to finish with a plus-7.
Chris Boucher had a three-minute, 10-point, plus-11 run in the game.
Scottie Barnes finished with 18 points, five rebounds, five assists, and four blocks, shooting 7-of-15 from the floor.
Ochai Agbaji left the game in the second quarter after suffering a lower back contusion in a rebounding collision with Josh Hart.
Post-Match Reflections: The Raptors' starting lineup had only played 19 minutes together over the past year, while the Knicks' starting lineup had played 19 minutes per game over 33 games this season.
The Raptors showed positive signs in the first half and early in the third quarter but ultimately lost their footing and saw the Knicks run away with the game.
The Raptors' inattention to detail and lack of consistent effort were highlighted as key issues in the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Darko Rajakovic used his challenge at the end of the second quarter to try to save Jakob Poeltl from a third foul, which was a low-leverage use of the challenge.
Eugene Omoruyi is joining the Raptors on a 10-day contract, replacing Bruno Fernando who was waived.
